item.title: Curvy points, the perimeter, and the complexity of convex toric domains
item.description: arXiv:2506.23498v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study the related notions of curvature and perimeter for toric boundaries and their implications for symplectic packing problems; a natural setting for this is a generalized version of convex toric domain which we also study, where there are no conditions on the moment polytope at all aside from convexity. We show that the subleading asymptotics of the ECH and elementary ECH capacities recover the perimeter of such domains in their liminf, without any genericity required, and hence the perimeter is an obstruction to a full filling. As an application, we give the first examples of the failure of packing stability by open subsets of compact manifolds with smooth boundary or with no boundary at all; this has implications for long-term super-recurrence. We also show that a single smooth point of positive curvature on the toric boundary obstructs the existence of an infinite staircase, and we build on this to completely classify smooth (generalized) convex toric domains which have an infinite staircase. We also extend a number of theorems to generalized convex toric domains, in particular the "concave to convex", embedding theorem and the "accumulation point theorem". A curvy point forces "infinite complexity"; we raise the question of whether an infinitely complex domain can ever have an infinite staircase and we give examples with infinite staircases and arbitrarily high finite complexity.
item.dc:creator: Dan Cristofaro-Gardiner, Nicki Magill, Dusa McDuff

item.title: Nodal Tangles
item.description: arXiv:2506.23754v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study piecewise linear knot diagrams in the base of almost toric fibrations of symplectic four-manifolds. These diagrams translate to deformations of the almost toric fibration. We give several applications to symplectic topology, among them a proof of a conjecture by Symington, the calculation of the displacement energy for many fibres of toric moment maps, and an elementary recipe for building and distinguishing Lagrangian torus knots.
item.dc:creator: Joel Schmitz

item.title: Shifted Lagrangian thickenings of shifted Poisson derived schemes
item.description: arXiv:2506.23348v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We prove that the space of shifted Poisson structures on a derived scheme $X$ locally of finite presentation is equivalent to the space of shifted Lagrangian thickenings out $X$, solving a conjecture in shifted Poisson geometry. As a corollary, we show that for $M$ a compact oriented $d$-dimensional manifold and an $n$-shifted Poisson structure on $X$, the mapping stack $\mathrm{Map}(M,X)$ has an $(n-d)$-shifted Poisson structure. It extends a known theorem for shifted symplectic structures to shifted Poisson structures.
item.dc:creator: Nikola Tomi\'c

item.title: Quiver subrepresentations and the Derksen-Weyman saturation property
item.description: arXiv:2506.23633v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Using Schofield's characterization of the dimension vectors of general subrepresentations of a representation of a quiver, we give a direct proof of the Derksen-Weyman saturation property.
item.dc:creator: Velleda Baldoni, Mich\`ele Vergne, Michael Walter

item.title: Tamarkin's separation theorem for non-compact objects in cotangent bundles
item.description: arXiv:2406.08247v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this short note, we prove a Tamarkin-type separation theorem for possibly non-compact subsets in cotangent bundles.
item.dc:creator: Yuichi Ike, Tatsuki Kuwagaki

item.title: Legendrian Structures in Derived Geometry
item.description: arXiv:2406.17416v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This is the third installment in a series of papers on the subject of derived contact structures. In this paper, we formally introduce the notion of a Legendrian structure in the derived context and provide natural constructions. We then present affine models and prove a Legendrian-Darboux theorem for the Legendrians in contact derived schemes.
item.dc:creator: Kadri \.Ilker Berktav

item.title: On invariants of families of lemniscate motions in the two-center problem
item.description: arXiv:2505.05052v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We determine four topological invariants introduced by Cieliebak-Frauenfelder-Zhao, based on Arnold's $J^+$-invariant, of periodic lemniscate motions in Euler's two-center problem.
item.dc:creator: Hanna Haeussler, Seongchan Kim
